1.long: I arrange, draw up, compose, but perhaps: I set down from memory, restore from memory.

1.brief: I carry out fully, fully convince
1.long: (lit: I carry full), (a) I complete, carry out fully, (b) I fully convince, satisfy fully, (c) I fully believe.
a thing done, a deed, action; a matter, an affair.

2.long: according to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as.
I hand over, pledge, hand down, deliver, commit, commend, betray, abandon.
(a) rule (kingly or magisterial), (b) plur: in a quasi-personal sense, almost: rulers, magistrates, (c) beginning.
a servant, an attendant, (a) an officer, lictor, (b) an attendant in a synagogue, (c) a minister of the gospel.

2.brief: I come into being, am born
2.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.

2.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
2.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.

3.brief: I think, seem, appear, it seems
3.long: I think, seem, appear, it seems.
I also, I too, but I.
I accompany, follow closely, characterize, both lit. and met.; I investigate.

3.brief: from above, from the beginning, again
3.long: (a) from above, from heaven, (b) from the beginning, from their origin (source), from of old, (c) again, anew.

3.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
3.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
in order, in succession, in the time immediately after, just after.
I write; pass: it is written, it stands written (in the scriptures).
most excellent, an official epithet, used in addressing a Roman of high rank, and in the second century one of equestrian (as distinguished from senatorial) rank.
Theophilus, a friend of Luke of equestrian rank, to whom the Gospel and Acts are dedicated.

4.brief: I come to know, discern, recognize
4.long: I come to know by directing my attention to him or it, I perceive, discern, recognize; aor: I found out.

4.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
4.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.

5.brief: I come into being, am born
5.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
in, on, among.
the, the definite article.
a day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Herod; four persons are called by this name: Herod the Great, Herod Antipas, Herod Agrippa, and Herod Agrippa the younger.
a king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor.
the, the definite article.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem.
a priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.).
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
name, character, fame, reputation.
Zechariah, (a) a priest referred to as a son of Jehoiada, (b) another priest, father of John the Baptist.

5.brief: from out, out from among, from
5.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
a class of priests who served for a stated number of days.
Abijah, (a) a king, son of Rehoboam, (b) founder of the eighth class of priests.
and, even, also, namely.
a woman, wife, my lady.

5.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
5.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

5.brief: from out, out from among, from
5.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
the, the definite article.
a daughter; hence (Hebraistic?), of any female descendent, however far removed; even of one unrelated: my young lady.
Aaron, son of Amram and Jochebed, brother of Moses.
and, even, also, namely.
the, the definite article.
name, character, fame, reputation.

5.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
5.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
Elizabeth, mother of John the Baptizer.

6.brief: but, on the other hand, and
6.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
just; especially, just in the eyes of God; righteous; the elect (a Jewish idea).

6.brief: before, in the presence of, in the eyes of
6.long: before, in the presence of, in the eyes of.

6.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
6.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

6.brief: a thing pronounced to be just
6.long: a thing pronounced (by God) to be righteous (just, the right); or the restoration of a criminal, a fresh chance given him; a righteous deed, an instance of perfect righteousness.
blameless, free from fault or defect.

7.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
7.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(a) in proportion as, according as, (b) because.
Elizabeth, mother of John the Baptizer.
a day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

order, (a) regular arrangement, (b) appointed succession, (c) position, rank.

a custom, habit; an institute, rite.
the duty (office) of a priest, priesthood.

9.long: (a) I obtain (receive) by lot, my lot (turn) is, (b) I draw lots.

9.brief: I go in, come in, enter
9.long: I go in, come in, enter.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
a temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides.

10.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
a multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage.
(a) a people, characteristically of God's chosen people, first the Jews, then the Christians, (b) sometimes, but rarely, the people, the crowd.
I pray, pray for, offer prayer.
(a) a definite space of time, a season, (b) an hour, (c) the particular time for anything.

11.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel, conveying news or behests from God to men.

trans: (a) I make to stand, place, set up, establish, appoint; mid: I place myself, stand, (b) I set in balance, weigh; intrans: (c) I stand, stand by, stand still; met: I stand ready, stand firm, am steadfast.

11.brief: from out, out from among, from
11.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.

John: the Baptist, the apostle, a member of the Sanhedrin, or John Mark.

wild joy, ecstatic delight, exultation, exhilaration.

15.long: large, great, in the widest sense.

15.long: before the face of, in the presence of, in the eyes of.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition.

belly, abdomen, heart, a general term covering any organ in the abdomen, e.g. stomach, womb; met: the inner man.
